title: Drawing, "Project for the Decoration of an oblong ceiling, with alternative suggestions", ca. 1730
medium: Graphite, pen and black ink, white heightening on blue paper
provenance:
Collection of Léon Decloux

Possibly ex-coll. Destailleur (sold, Paris, May 19 1896 for 25 francs.) Ref: H. Mireur, Dictionnaire des Ventes d'Art, Paris 1911, vol.2 p.279
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Two alternative designs are suggested for the cove: including festoons, scrolls, female masks, festoons, and gaines. For the center: including flower vases on brackets with doves and a spike design with vegetable motifs and shells.  The ceiling is divided by bands into the central, circular and four pentagonal coffers. Three alternative suggestions are made for the letters. Two of them show bracket motifs and putti.  One is decorated with an acanthus scroll from which a Bacchus gaine rises; a female head, a three-quarter figure of a child, rustic musical instruments are in the framing. The fourth shows a sphinx under a canopy, a festoon held by a half-figure.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for the Decoration of an oblong ceiling, with alternative suggestions", ca. 1730.
ca. 1730. Graphite, pen and black ink, white heightening on blue paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-24.
